sfinae英文直译过来“匹配失败也不算错误”，有了前面traits的概念就会知道，调用模板函数时编译器会根据传入参数推导最合适的模板函数，选择最合适的那一个意味其他模板匹配失败，但该匹配失败不会造成任何编译错误。

一元操作只有一个操作数（程序中默认为tensor），使用时只需要将一元操作的表达式传入traits，程序会自动匹配调用第一个struct，并在第一个struct中递归匹配调用第二个struct，最终得到tensor中存储元素的信息。

./.title: 1. Introduction
./.body:
HICE
HICE(High-performance intelligent computation engine) is a library base on tensor, which provide C++ API for basic math operations, machine learning algorithms , convolution operations etc. HICE is also support GPU now.

part2/.title: 2. Install Guide
part2/.body:
Install Guide

The steps, hardware and software dependent should be followed before using HICE.

No wonder using or adding new operations on HICE, the following install steps should be followed. The version of hardware and software should be consistent with the document.

part2/install_step.html.title: 2.1. Download and Install
part2/install_step.html.body:
Download and Install
Build from source
Download the HICE source code
git clone https://github.com/pku-hpc/hice.git

Compile

New a directory named build in hice.
cd hice
mkdir build


Compile in build
cd build
cmake ..
make
make install



Test

Turn on the test option in  CMakeList.txt.
option(ENABLE_TESTING "ENABLE tests" ON)

Recompile the program, and the execution test program is under build.
./dot_cpu_test



Optional: GPU Support

Inorder to use GPU in HICE, CUDA should be preinstalled. Turn on the cuda option in  CMakeList.txt.
option(USE_CUDA "Use CUDA" ON)

It's important to set the compile parameter in CMakeList.txt, which should be consistent with your GPU.
set(CMAKE_CUDA_FLAGS "--generate-code arch=compute_60,code=sm_60 -Xcompiler=-Wall")

part2/dependent_lib.html.title: 2.2. Hardware and software dependent
part2/dependent_lib.html.body:
Hardware and software dependent
Hardware Requirements

Software Requirements

part3/.title: 3. Modules
part3/.body:
Modules
The HICE library mainly include four modules, each module and function are shown below:

CORE module
Define the tensor structure, initial CPU/GPU device and construct basic expression template.

LA module
Basic math operation base on tensor, such as dot, transpose and so on.

ML module
Machine Learning Algorithms base on tensor.

NN module
Convolution operations base on tensor.

part3/core.html.title: 3.1. CORE Module
part3/core.html.body:
Core

This module is the basic component of HICE library, which define the tensor structure, initial CPU/GPU device and construct basic expression template.

part3/core/tensor.html.title: 3.1.1. Tensor

part3/la.html.title: 3.2. LA Module
part3/la.html.body:
la

This module include the basic math operations based on tensor such as dot, transpose and so on.

Operation Supported

Spmspv

Add new operations
If you want to add new operations, some rules need to be known here.
Add the cases to test if the new opreations run correctly, see here。

part3/la/spmspv.html.title: 3.2.1. Spmspv
part3/la/spmspv.html.body:
SpMspV (sparse matrix multiply sparse vector)
Algorithm description
y=Axy = Axy=Ax, where AAA is a sparse matrix, xxx is a sparse vector 
and yyy is the resultant dense vector. 
Storage
Sparse Matrix
The sparse matrix is stored in Compressed Sparse Column (CSC) format, 
which is composed of three 1-dimension vectors: val, row_index, col_offset. The val vector (nnz) stores the nonzeroes of the sparse matrix.
The row_index (nnz) stores the corresponding row index.
The col_offset (n+1) stores the index of the first value for each column in the val vector. 
 
Sparse Vector
The sparse vector is stored with two vectors: x_key, x_val. 
The len of both vectors are the number of the nonzeroes (x_nnz) for the sparse vector. 
x_key stores the index of the sparse vector.
x_val stores the value of the sparse vector.
Usage
// execute SpMspV on GPU.
SpMspV(m, n, nnz, row_index, col_offset, val, x_nnz, x_key, x_val, y);
Parameter

m：the number of the rows of the input sparse matrix，scalar.
n：the number of the columns of the input sparse matrix，scalar.
nnz：the number of the nonzeroes of the input sparse matrix，scalar.
row_index：the row index of the nonzeroes in the sparse matrix，a nnznnznnz-dimension vector.
col_offset:the index of the first value for each column of the nonzeroes in the sparse matrix, a n+1n+1n+1-dimension vector.
val：the nonzeroes values of the sparse matrix，a nnznnznnz-dimension vector.
x_nnz：the number of the nonzeroes of the input sparse vector，scalar.
x_key:the index of the sparse vector，a x_nnzx\_nnzx_nnz-dimension vector.
x_val:the value of the sparse vector，a x_nnzx\_nnzx_nnz-dimension vector.
y：the resultant dense vector，a mmm-dimension vector.

Performance
Performance comparison with the SpMV and the state-of-the-art push-pull SpmSpv.
  
  
Performance comparison with the number of nonzeroes of the input vector varying on ljournal-2008 dataset.

part3/ml.html.title: 3.3. ML Module
part3/ml.html.body:
ml

This module mainly support some basic machine learning algorithms.

Algorithm Supported

K-Nearest-Neighbor

Add new algorithms
If you want to add new machine learning algorithms, some rules need to be known here.
Add the cases to test if the new algorithm run correctly, see here。

part3/ml/knn.html.title: 3.3.1. K-Nearest-Neighbor
part3/ml/knn.html.body:
K-Nearest-Neighbor
Algorithm description
The training examples are vectors in a multidimensional feature space named ref, each with a class label named label. The training phase of the algorithm consists only of storing the feature vectorsand class labels of the training samples.In the classification phase, k is a user-defined constant, and unlabeled vectors query is classified by assigning the label which is most frequent among the k training samples nearest to that query point.
Usage
// default run on CPU
result = knn(ref, label, query, k);
// Use GPU speed up
result = knn(ref, label, query, k).to(CUDA);

Parameter

ref：Features for training dataset，a tensor shape as (ref_num, dim).
label：Labels for training dataset，a tensor shape as (ref_num, 1).
query：Features for test dataset，a tensor shape as (query_num, dim).
k：Select the nearest k points.

Return

result：Labels for test dataset，a tensor shape as (query_num, 1).

Performance

Running time of each parts

part3/nn.html.title: 3.4. NN Module
part3/nn.html.body:
nn

This module mainly support the convolution operations based on tensor.

part4/.title: 4. Extension
part4/.body:
Extension

If you want to add new operations, some basic rules need to  be known.


Add operations
Test operations

part4/new-op.html.title: 4.1. Add operations
part4/new-op.html.body:
Add operations
The basic operations of tensor，like dot，transpose are under la.Machine learning algorithms，like knn，svm are under ml. Convolution operations are under nn。
Five steps while coding：

Add the kernel in the namespace of engine, if the operation need to support cuda, use enable_if to do auto selection.
Add the struct of new operation in the namespace of op, there should have an apply function in struct to select proper kernel, see more here.
Add expression template for the new operation, see more here.
Add  evaluator for the new expression template.

Finally include the header of operation in src/hice.h.

part4/test-op.html.title: 4.2 Test operations
part4/test-op.html.body:
Test operations
Add new test code under test/, the test code should include hice.h. After that the compile command for the test file should be added in CMakeLists.txt under the same directory. For example:
# dot_cpu_test is a execuation program
# dot_cpu_test.cpp is the source code
add_executable(dot_cpu_test dot_cpu_test.cpp)
target_link_libraries(dot_cpu_test hice)
add_test(
  NAME dot_cpu_test
  COMMAND $
)
Finally rebuild the whole program.

SFINAE+enable_if
